hint: Hierarchical decomposition of deliverables into smaller components to support estimating, planning, and control.
Approved reference for deliverables and boundaries used to compare against actual work and manage modifications.
Approved reference for the timeline used to compare planned vs actual dates and manage deviations.
Approved time-phased budget used to measure spending performance and control changes.
Formal proposal to modify baselined commitments (deliverables, timeline, budget, quality) requiring evaluation and approval.
Decision group that reviews and approves/rejects proposed modifications to baselined commitments.
Central log capturing uncertainties, triggers, owners, responses, and status across the life cycle.
Tracking list for active problems, owners, due dates, and resolution status.
List of interested parties with contact details, influence, and engagement considerations.
Documented approach for what information is shared, with whom, how often, and via which channels.
Approach describing how conformance will be ensured through standards, metrics, and assurance activities.
Approach for sourcing, contract strategy, and vendor governance for external goods/services.
Approach for acquiring, developing, and managing people and physical resources.
Governance process to review and decide on modifications and update baselines accordingly.
Integrated measurement method combining progress, timeline, and budget to assess results and predict outcomes.
Efficiency index comparing earned progress to actual spending; values above 1 indicate favorable cost efficiency.
Schedule efficiency index comparing earned progress to planned progress; values above 1 indicate ahead of plan.
Total approved budget for the work; baseline funding amount.
Forecasted total cost at completion based on performance and remaining work assumptions.
Forecasted cost to finish the remaining work from this point forward.
Difference between budget at completion and estimate at completion; indicates expected overrun or underrun.
Required efficiency needed on remaining work to meet a target budget.
Longest chain of dependent activities determining minimum completion date; delays here delay the whole effort.
Amount of time an activity can slip without delaying the project completion date.
Risk modeling technique using repeated random sampling to estimate likely outcomes and ranges.
Relationship where one activity relies on another to start or finish.
Significant point or event used to mark progress or decision gates.
Approved reference version used to measure actuals and manage changes.
Captured insights about what worked and what didn’t to improve future delivery.
Team ceremony to inspect how work was done and agree improvements for next iteration.
Ordered list of work items maintained and continuously refined to maximize value delivery.
Subset of work items selected for an iteration plus a plan to deliver them.
Time-boxed iteration producing a usable increment with inspection and adaptation.
Shared criteria that must be met for an item to be complete and acceptable.
Short description of a need from an end-user perspective used to guide development.
Conditions that must be met for a work item to be accepted.
Servant-leader enabling the team, removing impediments, and fostering continuous improvement.
Role accountable for maximizing value through prioritization and clarity on outcomes.
Short daily synchronization to plan the next 24 hours and surface impediments.
Session to inspect the increment and adapt the backlog based on feedback.
Session where the team selects work and sets an iteration goal and plan.
Trend chart showing remaining work over time to support forecasting and transparency.
Lean method that visualizes work, limits WIP, and optimizes flow using pull-based system.
Constraint on simultaneous work to reduce overload and improve throughput.
Rate at which work items are completed; used to understand capacity and flow.
Elapsed time from starting a work item to finishing it.
Elapsed time from request to delivery/availability.
Potentially shippable slice of usable output produced at iteration end.
Responsibility mapping clarifying who is responsible, accountable, consulted, and informed.
